intro: Pholiurus pannonicus, commonly known as the Pannonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Pholiurus pannonicus plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
